TextBody:
Hi Armando,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke we checked the EPP server and the settings were okay there.

We asked if it is possible to check the settings on the Azure side as well:

Settings: https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EndpointProtector_5.9.4/page/Content/EndpointProtector/Admin/DirectoryServices/Overview.htm
API Permission - where it is: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/quickstart-configure-app-access-web-apis

Please let me know if you can make these settings and re-sync again. Please let us know if the issue is resolved after that.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hi Armando,

Happy to hear that it worked!

I would recommend keeping the Default Department as is, and using groups for separation. The Default Department is like the Organizational Unit of the business(it is default and also implemented by default for the EPP clients), and using Groups in order to separate the Users/Computers for departments.

Currently if you have EPP clients deployed to end users, they will most likely be set to Default Department.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000NmYjl:ref

Gracias Flaviu

Entiendo el tema de Departamento.

Por último me gustaría saber como se realiza la asociación de dispositivos nuevos a estos usuarios, ya registrados.
Hace un momento realice nuevamente la instalación del agente en mi equipo, pero siempre me genera un usuario nuevo.

Anexo captura.

Hi Armando,

Happy to hear that it worked!

I would recommend keeping the Default Department as is, and using groups for separation. The Default Department is like the Organizational Unit of the business(it is default and also implemented by default for the EPP clients), and using Groups in order to separate the Users/Computers for departments.

Currently if you have EPP clients deployed to end users, they will most likely be set to Default Department.

Best Regards,

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #441199 -  - Dudas de Gestion    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NmYjl:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Armando,

You are welcome!

I will try to explain how the EPP client works with regards to Username and Computer name: Once the EPP client is installed it will read the Username from Windows and the Computer Name and devices from Device Manager. Then it will send this information to the EPP server.

In our case, where we have 2 usernames the below might have happened:
1. Either the "wrong" Username was created manually from the EPP server and then the "correct" Username was read by the EPP client and sent to the EPP server.
2. It is possible if the Username was updated/changed at one point for both Usernames to appear on the EPP server.
3. If the EPP client was upgraded recently from an older version, it is possible that after the upgrade the Username was updated(created a new Username, but also kept the old one).
4. Considering we are using Azure AD sync, there is an option "Map on-premises users" when creating the sync :

What this option does:

The "Map on-premises users" switch in the Azure Active Directory connector controls how Endpoint Protector (EPP) retrieves user names in hybrid environments with both a local Active Directory and Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). This switch has two states:

● Unmarked (feature disabled): EPP uses the "userPrincipalName" Azure AD attribute
to retrieve user names. This attribute is the primary source for user identification and
account mapping.

● Marked (feature enabled): EPP uses the "onPremisesSamAccountName" Azure AD
attribute to retrieve user names, ensuring accurate synchronization between the local
Active Directory and Azure AD.

By utilizing this feature, EPP ensures seamless synchronization of user names, preventing duplicate usernames. Enable or disable the "Map on-premises users" feature based on your specific hybrid environment setup and requirements.

I believe that 1 of the 4 instances mentioned above occurred and that is what generated the extra user. You can delete the incorrect user and use the correct one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
